1.name: CueSongs

0.caption: Homepage - the initial page that people would see when they arrive on the website and after they log in.

1.caption: Artist's Page - where users could view all the tracks that belonged to an artist on our site.

2.caption: Checkout Page - where users could find out prices of licensing a track and then go through the payment process.

3.caption: Meet The Team page - where each member of staff picked an album that had the most sentimental artwork to them.

4.caption: My Licences page - where a user could view all their previously licensed tracks and the data for them.

5.caption: User's Playlist - where a user can see the tracks that they added to the playlist, as well as share the playlist with others.

1.description: I carried out design & maintenance work on the CueSongs e-commerce website.

2.name: Forbidden Codes

0.caption: Digital Artwork - design done for the digital edition of the release.

1.caption: Sleeve Sticker - sticker designed for the clear sleeve of the vinyl releases.

2.caption: Vinyl Centre Label - an example of what the center label for each vinyl release of the compilation series looks like.

3.caption: Vinyl Sleeve (Back Cover) - artwork done for the back of the original vinyl sleeve, which later was changed to be a clear plastic sleeve with a sticker on one side.

4.caption: Lineup Teaser - artwork done for online promotion of the release, teasing the artist lineup.

5.caption: Photo of Vinyl - photograph of the finished product.

2.description: This is a collection of artwork that I completed for a various artists compilation on a record label called 117 Records.

3.name: 7 Per Cent

0.caption: Website Screencap - the middle logo being a clickable button that took the user to a randomly picked design inspiration website.

3.description: I designed and implemented a small (one page) website for fun. The aim of the website was to load random design inspirational sites once you click on the main button/emblem.

4.name: Science HKI

0.caption: Podcast Art - design for my episode's artwork, using a photograph I took in South Woodford, using a homemade pinhole camera.

4.description: This is the artwork that I designed for my edition of a DJ podcast called Science HKI, which is based in Finland. The picture used is one from I used my own collection of film photographs.

5.name: Storylines

0.caption: Digital Cover - artwork to be used for the digital release of the EP.

1.caption: Sleeve Sticker - design for the sticker to be used on the top of the vinyl sleeve of the EP.

5.description: I designed the artwork (using my own photography) for an EP (multiple track release) of mine that will be coming out soon on a record label called Skeleton Recordings.

6.name: Special Projects

0.caption: Front Cover - design for the front cover for the CD & digital versions.

1.caption: Back Cover - design for the back cover for the CD version.

2.caption: CD - design for the CD disc.

3.caption: Promotional Art 1 - some additional artwork designed for promotional use.

4.caption: Promotional Art 2 - some additional artwork designed for promotional use.

5.caption: Promotional Art 3 - some additional artwork designed for promotional use.

6.description: I created these designs using some film photography of mine for an album release that was shelved before it went to manufacture.

8.name: Working Title

0.caption: Album Cover - main album artwork designed for use on each track of the 'Working Title' series I was releasing.

8.description: Digital cover I created using my own photography of a series of free downloads that I released on my SoundCloud page.

9.name: Hex Digital

0.caption: Homepage - screenshot of the implementation based on the homepage design supplied for a fictional company.

1.caption: Work Page - screenshot of the implementation based on the design supplied to show the fictional company's work.

9.description: I created this website as part of an interview for an internship with a digital agency in Dalston.

10.name: Filter Mag

0.caption: Homepage - mockup I designed of the homepage.

10.description: I designed this mockup design of a music magazine website, that I was planning on implementing with a group of friends but did not have the time to do so.

11.name: Critical Sound
11.description: I created this concept design, based on a various artist compilation on a drum & bass label.

13.name: 117 Records

0.caption: House Sleeve - the design for use with the vinyl releases, but was not used.

1.caption: Vinyl Center Label (Logo Side) - the design for the logo side of the center label for each vinyl release.

2.caption: Vinyl Center Label (Text Side) - the design for the text side of the center label for each vinyl release.

3.caption: Letter Masthead - the design for the masthead used on documents related to the record label operations.

4.caption: Photo of Vinyl - a photograph of what one of the finished vinyl releases looked like.

13.description: I was tasked with creating a 'style guide' for a newly formed record label called 117 Records & based on the requirements provided by the label owner, this was the outcome.

14.name: Amen Warfare

0.caption: CD Front Cover - the design for the front cover of the CD version of the release.

1.caption: CD Back Cover - the design for the back cover of the CD version of the release.

2.caption: CD 1 Disc Art - the CD artwork design for disc 1.

3.caption: CD 2 Disc Art - the CD artwork design for disc 2.

4.caption: Vinyl Sleeve (Front Cover) - the design for the front cover of the vinyl version of the release.

5.caption: Vinyl Sleeve (Back Cover) - the design for the back cover of the vinyl version of the release.

6.caption: Vinyl Center Label - an example of what the center label of the vinyl releases would look like.

14.description: I created this set of designs for a various artists compilation I was also featuring on. The plans were changed at the last minute and no vinyl or CD manufactured for the release, so only the digital art (modified version of the front of vinyl sleeve) was used.
